alert.note: Alert for Lower Slopes of the Eastern Washington Cascades Crest (Washington) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Pendleton (Northeast Oregon and Southeast Washington)
info.headline: Blizzard Warning issued January 10 at 3:21AM PST until January 10 at 10:00AM PST by NWS Pendleton
info.description: ...BLIZZARD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 AM PST THIS MORNING... ...WINTER STORM WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM THURSDAY MORNING THROUGH LATE SATURDAY NIGHT... * WHAT...For the Blizzard Warning, blizzard conditions. Additional snow accumulations of up to two inches. Winds gusting as high as 40 mph. For the Winter Storm Watch, heavy snow possible. Total snow accumulations of 10 to 20 inches possible. Winds could gust as high as 50 mph. * WHERE...Lower Slopes of the Eastern Washington Cascades Crest. * WHEN...For the Blizzard Warning, until 10 AM PST this morning. For the Winter Storm Watch, from Thursday morning through late Saturday night. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult to impossible. Patchy blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. The hazardous conditions could impact the morning or evening commute. Strong winds could cause tree damage. The cold wind chills as low as 20 below zero could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 30 minutes.
info.instruction: Travel should be restricted to emergencies only. If you must travel, have a winter survival kit with you. If you get stranded, stay with your vehicle. Monitor the latest forecasts for updates on this situation. The latest road conditions can be obtained for Oregon by calling 5 1 1 or by visiting online at https://tripcheck.com, or for Washington by visiting online at https://wsdot.com/travel.

area.areaDesc: Lower Slopes of the Eastern Washington Cascades Crest
